q: wrote. While some of these roles will be covered by frigates, helicopters and the C130 Hercules, the "strategic multi-role contribution of Nimrod" will not be replicated, the six argued. In a week when reports suggest that the government is seeking to impose even more severe cuts on the defence budget, it is not perverse to suggest that the gap left by broken Nimrods should be readdressed, the letter concluded. Its other signatories were Air Vice Marshal Tony Mason, Air Commodore Andrew Lambert and Major General Patrick Cordingley .
